messages.message:
hey everyone, sometimes I get this when trying to run `make build-docker run-docker-proxy`  in `server-nginx` .

``` > [2/6] RUN apt-get update -y:
#5 0.348 Get:1 http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-security InRelease [88.7 kB]
#5 0.454 Err:1 http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-security InRelease
#5 0.454   At least one invalid signature was encountered.
#5 0.477 Get:2 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic InRelease [242 kB]
#5 0.885 Err:2 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic InRelease
#5 0.885   At least one invalid signature was encountered.
#5 0.913 Get:3 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-updates InRelease [88.7 kB]
#5 0.996 Err:3 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-updates InRelease
#5 0.996   At least one invalid signature was encountered.
#5 1.019 Get:4 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-backports InRelease [74.6 kB]
#5 1.093 Err:4 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-backports InRelease
#5 1.093   At least one invalid signature was encountered.
#5 1.097 Reading package lists...
#5 1.109 W: GPG error: http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-security InRelease: At least one invalid signature was encountered.
#5 1.109 E: The repository 'http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-security InRelease' is not signed.
#5 1.109 W: GPG error: http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic InRelease: At least one invalid signature was encountered.
#5 1.109 E: The repository 'http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic InRelease' is not signed.
#5 1.109 W: GPG error: http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-updates InRelease: At least one invalid signature was encountered.
#5 1.109 E: The repository 'http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-updates InRelease' is not signed.
#5 1.109 W: GPG error: http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-backports InRelease: At least one invalid signature was encountered.
#5 1.109 E: The repository 'http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu bionic-backports InRelease' is not signed.
------
executor failed running [/bin/sh -c apt-get update -y]: exit code: 100
make[1]: *** [build] Error 1
make: *** [fetch-www-pages] Error 2```
Any ideas why? I usually have to run `docker system prune`  then I get to spend 30 minutes rebuilding everything :upside_down_face: . Can someone help me avoid that? :thank_you:
what’s the size of your docker partition? maybe try bumping that up a bunch. 100GB?
Dang, maybe I do need to prune since I’m using that much?
i have it set to 100GB, and i need to run `docker system prune` only every couple of months
do you have to run prune very often?
how much is left after you run prune?

i sometimes do a bunch of manual pruning as well to keep it down. If you do “docker images” and see a bunch of really old images still in there, you can do “docker rmi <docker-image-name>:<version> to manually remove it.
it usually blows up for me whenever new base containers are built. you can delete all docker images with old base container versions.
I got it down to about 70GBs I’m doing more pruning
Got some old stuff in there right now
yeah keep going, you can probably get it down to 30gb if you keep `rmi`-ing aggressively
